chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
items.plainText: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

items.text: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;
items.plainText: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;

items.text: When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;
items.plainText: When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;

items.text: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;
items.plainText: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;

items.text: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;
items.plainText: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;

items.text: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;
items.plainText: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;

items.text: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!
items.plainText: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!

items.text: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.
items.plainText: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.

items.text: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.
items.plainText: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.

items.text: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
items.plainText: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.

items.text: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:
items.plainText: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:

items.text: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.
items.plainText: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.

items.text: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.
items.plainText: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.

items.text: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.
items.plainText: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.

items.text: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.
items.plainText: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.

items.text: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.
items.plainText: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.

items.text: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
items.plainText: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.

items.text: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.
items.plainText: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.

items.text: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.
items.plainText: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.

items.text: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.
items.plainText: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.

items.text: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.
items.plainText: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.

items.text: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.
items.plainText: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.

items.text: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
items.plainText: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.

items.text: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.
items.plainText: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.

items.text: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
items.plainText: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
